summary.p: Wants to greet him briefly, as he has just written to him through John Butler [No. 1256]. The assignment of the letter carrier is unknown to him, but probably relates to the Frankfurt meeting. Myconius should inform Bullinger of what he learns from there.

div.p: Grace and innocence of life from the Lord.

Having conveniently found a messenger, most esteemed Myconius, I wanted to greet you with this and wish you happiness. Otherwise, at present, I have nothing to write. A few days ago, I wrote what I had through Johann Buttler. We are all well; I wish that you are also well with all of yours.
The reason why this messenger was sent here, I do not fully know; you will undoubtedly learn it from yours. I suspect he was sent because of the Frankfurt assembly. Farewell and always love me.
Greet Mr. Grynaeus, Gast, Buttler, Ryffenstein, my Gwalther, and the other friends and brothers.
Your H. Bullinger. I beg you, if you have any certain news from the Frankfurt assembly, share it.
To the most esteemed lord and brother, Oswald Myconius.
